archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Kung Pao-Style Chicken with Peanuts over Jasmine Rice
description: Stovetop Chinese-inspired chicken stir-fry with a tangy, medium-heat chili-soy glaze and crunchy peanuts, served over fluffy jasmine rice.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; set aside.
Trim and cut 700 g chicken thighs into 2–3 cm pieces; pat dry.
Slice 2 bell peppers into strips and 1 onion into thin wedges.
Mince 4 cloves garlic and slice 4 spring onion (separate whites and greens).
Stir together sauce in a bowl: 1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1–2 tbsp sriracha, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 2 tsp cornflour, and 1/3 cup water.
Measure 1/2 cup peanuts and set aside.
Optional (for quicker plating): Warm pre-cooked rice in the microwave just before serving.
cook_steps: Cook jasmine rice on the stovetop per pack directions (use 1:1.5 rice-to-water ratio); keep covered to steam.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high; add 1 tbsp canola oil. Toast peanuts for 1–2 minutes until fragrant; remove to a bowl.
Add remaining 1 tbsp canola oil. Stir-fry chicken in a single layer 4–5 minutes until browned and mostly cooked; season with a pinch of salt and remove to a plate.
In the same pan, add onion wedges and bell pepper; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add garlic and spring onion whites; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return chicken to the pan. Stir the sauce (cornflour settles) and pour it in; add 1/2 tsp chili flakes.
Stir-fry 1–2 minutes until the sauce bubbles and thickens, coating the chicken and vegetables. Reduce heat to medium if needed.
Turn off heat; drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil (optional). Toss in toasted peanuts and spring onion greens.
Fluff rice and serve bowls of rice topped with kung pao-style chicken and extra chili flakes to taste.
